content:
• Tuesday, October 23, 2012

  • Already higher on the session after a fast Australian CPI reading, the aussie spikes another 20...

    Already higher on the session after a fast Australian CPI reading, the aussie spikes another 20 pips following China's encouraging PMI report. The aussie currently +0.4% and buying $1.0309.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 PM
  • NFLX

    In addition to issuing soft subscriber growth guidance in his company's Q3 report and...

    In addition to issuing soft subscriber growth guidance in his company's Q3 report and shareholder letter (.pdf), Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) CEO Reed Hastings made waves by admitting competition from Amazon, Hulu, and others is a matter of concern, and predicting HBO (NYSE:TWX) will launch a streaming-only U.S. service. Also of concern: 1) Netflix's "known" content liabilities total $5B, of which $2.1B are due in the next 12 months. 2) Domestic streaming's contributing margin remains ~1/3 that of the declining DVD business. Shares -16.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 PM | 17 Comments
  • PLCM

    Along with announcing a Q3 beat, Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) discloses it has settled a lawsuit to...

    Along with announcing a Q3 beat, Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) discloses it has settled a lawsuit to enforce the $110M sale of its enterprise cordless phone business to P-E firm Sun Capital. Polycom will be paid $53M up-front (subject to some adjustments), and $57M over the next four years (subject to EBITDA milestones). The deal is expected to close by Dec. 15. Shares +3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) +5.8% AH after announcing a restructuring that will include a...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) +5.8% AH after announcing a restructuring that will include a $15M-$20M/year reduction in "core" R&D expenses, and a voluntary retirement program it expects will lower expenses by over $10M/year. The company, which has traditionally focused on broad licenses for its mobile IP, is also creating a Solutions unit that will focus on developing "market-ready technologies" such as its M2M and baseband modem IP.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • DCI

    Donaldson Company (NYSE:DCI) guides FY13 estimates lower across the board. It now sees FY13 Q1...

    Donaldson Company (NYSE:DCI) guides FY13 estimates lower across the board. It now sees FY13 Q1 EPS to be around $0.30 - $0.36 per share, with full year sales between $2.52B - $2.62B, and full year EPS in a range of $1.68 - $1.88. Current consensus estimates are for FY 2013 revenue of $2.8B, a full year EPS of $1.97, and Q1 EPS at $0.45. Shares -3.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • AKS

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) might be interested in the two steel mills in Brazil and the U.S. that...

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) might be interested in the two steel mills in Brazil and the U.S. that ThyssenKrupp has put up for sale, CEO James Wainscott said on a conference call following the steel company's Q3 results. He did not indicate whether AKS actually had made a bid or was considering one; AKS was not believed to have submitted a first-round bid for the assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZNGA

    From Facebook's Q3 call and earnings slides: Instagram registered users surpass 100M, up from...

    From Facebook's Q3 call and earnings slides: Instagram registered users surpass 100M, up from 27M at time of acquisition. Ad impressions +27% Y/Y, ad prices +7%. North America 50% of revenue, ad prices up sharply, offset some by lower impressions due to mobile shift. Ad prices fell in Europe, up slightly in Asia. North American ARPU still dwarfs that of faster-growing regions. News feed ads on $4M/day run rate, 3/4 of that from mobile. Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) was 43% of Payments revenue, down from 52% in Q2. Headcount +9% Q/Q. FB +10.4% AH. (webcast, live blog, slides - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • QRVO

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RFMD +12%; TWIN +9.2%; FB +8.2%; IDIX +6.5%; PNRA...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RFMD +12%; TWIN +9.2%; FB +8.2%; IDIX +6.5%; PNRA +6.4%.
    After-hours top losers: INVN -19.1%; TPX -18.4%; IRBT -15.2%; BWLD -10.2%; UTHR -9.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNPR

    More on Juniper's Q3: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $1.1B-$1.13B and EPS of $0.19-$0.22, below a...

    More on Juniper's Q3: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $1.1B-$1.13B and EPS of $0.19-$0.22, below a consensus of $1.15B and $0.24. Q3 product revenue -3% Y/Y, services +15%. Routing product sales -7% Y/Y (share losses to Cisco), switching +20% (share gains), security -9% (likely share losses to Palo Alto Networks). Service provider revenue +3%, enterprise -2%. Switching/routing chief Stefan Dyckerhoff stepping down to become a VC, will remain a consultant. JNPR +2.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • QRVO

    More on RF Micro's FQ2: 3G/4G sales made up over 75% of mobile component division's revenue, a...

    More on RF Micro's FQ2: 3G/4G sales made up over 75% of mobile component division's revenue, a sign the company's 2G sales to Nokia and Chinese OEMs are now less of a headwind. Wi-Fi sales (a smaller business) rose 15% Q/Q, and a major smartphone design win was scored. FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $245M and EPS of $0.06, above a consensus of $217.8M and $0.04. RFMD +11.7% AH. SWKS +1.8% AH. TQNT +1.6%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • CMRE

    Costamare (NYSE:CMRE): Q3 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $94.9M (-5% Y/Y) beats by $2M....

    Costamare (NYSE:CMRE): Q3 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $94.9M (-5% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • GILD

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q3 beats across the board. Net earnings fell 8.9% Y/Y...

    More on Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD): Q3 beats across the board. Net earnings fell 8.9% Y/Y however, on higher R&D expenses to advance its liver disease and oncolodgy products. Overall product sales rose 14%, with sales of antiviral products, its dominant revenue stream, increasing 13%. HIV drugs Atripla and Truvada both saw sales gains of 9% and 8%, respectively. Royalty, contract and other revenue from collaborations were up 23% from the prior year. Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH): Q3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $1.54B beats by $30M....

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH): Q3 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $1.54B beats by $30M. Shares +7.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • HBI

    Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI): Q3 EPS of $1.11 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.22B (+3% Y/Y) in-line....

    Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI): Q3 EPS of $1.11 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.22B (+3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • TPX

    More on Tempur-Pedic's (NYSE:TPX) Q3: The company continues to get hammered by pricing pressure...

    More on Tempur-Pedic's (NYSE:TPX) Q3: The company continues to get hammered by pricing pressure in the sector, with sales in North America falling off 14% Y/Y for the period, only partially offset by a 3% gain in global sales. Gross profit margin slipped 320 bps to 49.2%. The outlook for 2012 sales is lowered to $1.4B and 2012 EPS is taken to $2.55. Shares -14.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (NYSE:INVN): FQ2 EPS of $0.16 in-line. Revenue of $55.3M (+29% Y/Y) misses by $0.2M....

    InvenSense (NYSE:INVN): FQ2 EPS of $0.16 in-line. Revenue of $55.3M (+29% Y/Y) misses by $0.2M. Chairman/CEO Steven Nasiri is stepping down, and is being replaced as CEO by board member/Broadcom exec Behrooz Abdi. Shares -9.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • INTC

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR): Q3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $495M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $12M....

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR): Q3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $495M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • ILMN

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q3 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $285.9M in-line. Shares +1.3%...

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q3 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $285.9M in-line. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +3.2% AH and Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) +2.2% following Facebook's Q3 beat, which...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +3.2% AH and Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) +2.2% following Facebook's Q3 beat, which was driven by improved mobile monetization. Zynga's gains come even though Facebook reported a 9% Q/Q drop in its Payments revenue, which depends heavily on Zynga virtual goods sales, as mobile gaming takes a toll on PC activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • PNRA

    More on Panera Bread's Q3 (NASDAQ:PNRA): Company-owned comparable net bakery-cafe sales rose...

    More on Panera Bread's Q3 (NASDAQ:PNRA): Company-owned comparable net bakery-cafe sales rose 6.2% Y/Y. Improved operating margin by 80 bps compared to last year. Added a net 34 bakery-cafes during the quarter. Sees Q4 company-owned comparable sales growth of 5.0%-6.0%. Sets initial FY13 EPS guidance at $6.85-$7.00. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • NFLX

    More from the Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q3 report: Sees negative cash flow the quarter. The company...

    More from the Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q3 report: Sees negative cash flow the quarter. The company misses estimates with its outlook for net domestic streaming sub adds, lowering the mark all the way down to 4.7M-5.4M from prior guidance of 7M. Shares -14.3% AH. (letter to shareholders, earnings release)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • FB

    More on Facebook's Q3: Monthly active users (MAUs) totaled 1.01B as of Sep. 30, +6% Q/Q and +26%...

    More on Facebook's Q3: Monthly active users (MAUs) totaled 1.01B as of Sep. 30, +6% Q/Q and +26% Y/Y. Mobile MAUs hit 604M, +11% Q/Q and +61% Y/Y. Mobile accounted for 14% of ad revenue (impressive, since first mobile ads arrived this year). Ad sales +9% Q/Q and +36% Y/Y. Payments -9% Q/Q and +13% Y/Y. Expenses +57% Y/Y, much higher than revenue growth. Capex (including leased gear) was $332M, down from Q2's $465M. FB now +9.3% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 7 Comments
  • TPX

    Tempur-pedic International (NYSE:TPX): Q3 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $347.9M (-9%...

    Tempur-pedic International (NYSE:TPX): Q3 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $347.9M (-9% Y/Y) misses by $16M. Shares -15.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread Company (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q3 EPS of $1.24 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $529.3M (+16.8%...

    Panera Bread Company (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q3 EPS of $1.24 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $529.3M (+16.8% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q3 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $905M (+10.1% Y/Y) misses by...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q3 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $905M (+10.1% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -14.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD): Q3 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $245M beats by $28M. Shares...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD): Q3 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $245M beats by $28M. Shares +10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • OSGB

    Overseas Shipholding (OSG +21.1%) shares bounce back somewhat after yesterday's precipitous...

    Overseas Shipholding (OSG +21.1%) shares bounce back somewhat after yesterday's precipitous fall, but they're chopped in half since Friday's close. OSG warned it's evaluating strategic options, including potential bankruptcy protection, and said several previous financial statements shouldn't be relied on.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • RSH

    As expected, BofA defends its Buy rating on Radio Shack (RSH +5.2%) with the stance that the...

    As expected, BofA defends its Buy rating on Radio Shack (RSH +5.2%) with the stance that the long-term outlook is still positive despite the retailer bombing with results in Q3. Execs with the company also tried to pitch the bull case on an earnings CC (transcript), but the Q&A honed in on how the company plans to gets its cost structure in line to a point where it can return to profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • HUBG

    Hub Group (HUBG +2.8%) reported better than expected Q3 results, and Morgan Stanley is...

    Hub Group (HUBG +2.8%) reported better than expected Q3 results, and Morgan Stanley is encouraged by the shipping firm's exposure to the "intermodal secular growth story." But the firm notes pricing difficulties HUBG faces, so it favors fellow intermodal play J.B. Hunt (JBHT +0.6%) for its "competitive advantage provided by its unique rail contracts."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • MOLX

    Shares of Molex (MOLX -3.2%) slide after missing on its FQ1 top line earlier today. Net revenue...

    Shares of Molex (MOLX -3.2%) slide after missing on its FQ1 top line earlier today. Net revenue declined 2% Y/Y For Q2, as its bottom line was impacted by start-up costs and product mix changes related to new programs launched in the quarter. The company also guided its current quarter lower, now expecting an EPS of $0.36 - $0.40, below the consensus of $0.42. It projects revenues to be $930M - $970M, in line with the Street view of $940.8M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (MNST -10.5%) looks enticing to opportunistic traders after shares fall off...

    Monster Beverage (MNST -10.5%) looks enticing to opportunistic traders after shares fall off with the company targeted by a lawsuit and FDA investigation over deaths linked to consumption of its energy drink. The rationale is that lopping off over a billion dollars worth of the company's market cap could be a harsh reaction to what even the FDA considers unconfirmed allegations. As for tighter regulation of energy drinks, bulls note with Coca-Cola and PepsiCo lurking in the space, the issue could stay stuck in neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 10 Comments
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2%) says it will receive $1.1M from Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2%) says it will receive $1.1M from Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +0.2%) as its portion of the upfront fees in ALNY's recently announced collaboration with Genzyme. In addition, Isis has the potential to receive royalty payments and a portion of future milestone payments. Already this year, Isis has earned $2.7M from Alnylam as a result of licenses that were supported by Isis' patents.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • XLE

    Oil futures settle below $87/bbl for the first time since mid-July, -2.2% to $86.67, as a...

    Oil futures settle below $87/bbl for the first time since mid-July, -2.2% to $86.67, as a stronger dollar and weakness in the broader market pressured prices. Also, the restart of the Keystone pipeline eased supply concerns. Energy stocks (NYSEARCA:XLE) fall hard, -2.1% vs. broader S&P -1.1%. However, natural gas rebounded, perhaps on expectations for colder weather or simply a bounce off yesterday's big drop.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Pandora (P +9.9%) is staring at huge gains on a down day. The fact Apple's event came and went...

    Pandora (P +9.9%) is staring at huge gains on a down day. The fact Apple's event came and went without the launch of an Internet radio service could be helping, but shares were already up strongly before the event. 53.1% of Pandora's float was shorted as of Sep. 28, which means it doesn't take much to stoke a short-covering rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +6%) is surging as investors show their appreciation of Apple's decision...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +6%) is surging as investors show their appreciation of Apple's decision to start iPad Mini pricing at $329. B&N new 7" Nook HD sells for $199-$229, while the 9" Nook HD+ goes for $269-$299. Shares sold off yesterday on Apple-related worries. Texas Instruments (TXN -0.4%), which (for now) supplies processors for both the Nook and Kindle lines, could be an indirect beneficiary of the Mini's pricing. Ditto Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), whose processors go into the Nexus 7 and other Android tablets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 9 Comments
  • DWDP

    DuPont (DD -8.9%) follows its ugly Q3 earnings assessment with a declaration that its...

    DuPont (DD -8.9%) follows its ugly Q3 earnings assessment with a declaration that its infrastructure projects in China had "stalled." CEO Ellen Kullman tells analysts during the post-earnings conference call she had visited China two weeks ago and noted demand had been hit by uncertainty over upcoming leadership changes, though economic stimulus efforts were starting to bear fruit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • DWDP

    The slide in DuPont (DD -9%) shares wipes away all their 2012 gains following the weak Q3...

    The slide in DuPont (DD -9%) shares wipes away all their 2012 gains following the weak Q3 earnings report. But DD says it remains on track to achieve its full-year 2012 productivity targets for both fixed costs and working capital, and it is "taking the necessary steps" to move long-term into higher growth, higher margin businesses such as agriculture, nutrition and biotech. Also: DOW -3.1%, MON -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNC

    Centene (CNC +0.6%) holds up today in spite of posting a mixed Q3 report that missed on the top...

    Centene (CNC +0.6%) holds up today in spite of posting a mixed Q3 report that missed on the top line. Net earnings fell 87% Y/Y as higher medical costs masked better-than-expected revenue growth. Last week, the medicaid insurer said it planned to exit the Kentucky market because it couldn't resolve differences with the state over high-cost issues, but today investors appear to be more focused on the company's cost-cutting efforts going forward than the earnings-squeezing mess the high cost environment created in 3Q.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • OHI

    Assisted living facility manager Omega Healthcare Investors (OHI -1.7%) is down after being cut...

    Assisted living facility manager Omega Healthcare Investors (OHI -1.7%) is down after being cut to Hold on valuation earlier today at Jefferies. The firm cites limited upside catalysts for the REIT, especially with the heightened uncertainty surrounding the reimbursement environment for skilled nursing facilities with respect to the upcoming Presidential Election.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARMH

    Chip stocks are outperforming a little following ARM's (ARMH +11.6%) pleasing Q3 report (I, II),...

    Chip stocks are outperforming a little following ARM's (ARMH +11.6%) pleasing Q3 report (I, II), in which the company reported a 16% Y/Y increase in Q2 unit shipments (from which Q3 royalties were derived). Beaten-down PC chip stocks are among the winners: AMD +3.8%. NVDA +2.9%. INTC +1.1%. Earlier today, AMD launched its Vishera desktop CPU line - AMD is counting on the 4 and 8-core CPUs, which are priced aggressively, to help reverse share losses to Intel's Ivy Bridge. Reviewers offer tempered praise.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • PRSN

    BSD Medical (BSDM +25.4%) leaps after reporting clinical data demonstrating a threefold increase...

    BSD Medical (BSDM +25.4%) leaps after reporting clinical data demonstrating a threefold increase in tumor destruction in patients with advanced rectal cancer after using its its BSD-2000 Hyperthermia System in addition to preoperative radiochemotherapy. The treatment left no evidence of a viable tumor in a statistically significant number of patients. Researchers also said hyperthermia may sufficiently reduce tumor size to allow for increased rates of sphincter preservation surgery, thus allowing patients to maintain normal rectal function.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -3.7%) has unveiled the Lumia 510, a ~$200 (unsubsidized) Windows Phone 7.5 model...

    Nokia (NOK -3.7%) has unveiled the Lumia 510, a ~$200 (unsubsidized) Windows Phone 7.5 model aimed at emerging markets. The 510, which sports a 4" display, 5MP camera, and 800MHz. Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) processor, is the cheapest Lumia model yet. But it's still more costly than many of the low-end Android phones that have been eating into Nokia's sales in emerging markets. Nokia and Microsoft have said they want to eventually offer $100 Windows Phones. (debt offering)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 23 Comments
  • ANNB

    Midday top 10 gainers: ANNB +48%. HLYS +22%. BSDM +21%. OSG +20%. COGO +13%. MNI +9%. ARMH +9%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: ANNB +48%. HLYS +22%. BSDM +21%. OSG +20%. COGO +13%. MNI +9%. ARMH +9%. MUSA +8%. VRNG +8%. COH +8%.
    Top 10 Losers: BCOM -13%. TDG -11%. LAWS -10%. VSCI -10%. MNST -10%. TROX -10%. HSTM -10%. ALV -10%. DVR -9%. PTNR -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -6.4%) is having a rough day after announcing CEO Eyal Waldman and CFO Michael...

    Mellanox (MLNX -6.4%) is having a rough day after announcing CEO Eyal Waldman and CFO Michael Gray have adopted Rule 10b5-1 trading plans. Waldman's plan will allow him to sell (through a general partnership) 169.1K shares starting in January, and Gray's plan will allow him to sell 55.5K shares. Mellanox was crushed last week after providing soft Q4 guidance, though shares are still up over 100% YTD. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +1.9%) trades higher after the Texas court handling the company's infringement suit...

    VirnetX (VHC +1.9%) trades higher after the Texas court handling the company's infringement suit against Apple and Cisco rejects an Apple motion for summary judgment, as well as an Apple/Cisco motion to stay the trial pending an ongoing patent reexamination. A motion to exclude the "expert opinions" of a VirnetX witness was also shot down.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2.5%) dips on a downgrade to Perform on valuation at Oppenheimer....

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2.5%) dips on a downgrade to Perform on valuation at Oppenheimer. The firm says that Ponatinib, its potential treatment for chronic myeloid leukemia, is already priced into the stock, and notes that it's too early to call its lung cancer drug AP26113 a winner.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP -3.2%) slips toward its 52-week low following a downgrade to Neutral from Baird:...

    NetApp (NTAP -3.2%) slips toward its 52-week low following a downgrade to Neutral from Baird: the firm cites growing competition from EMC, which it believes is leading to aggressive discounts, as well as from flash storage providers. Shares have been pressured by concerns about competition and IT spending, as well as OEM partner Xyratex's struggles.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • URZ

    Uranerz Energy (URZ +3.3%) is one of the few gainers among energy and natural resource stocks...

    Uranerz Energy (URZ +3.3%) is one of the few gainers among energy and natural resource stocks after receiving a deep disposal well permit for its Nichols Ranch uranium project in Wyoming's Powder River Basin. The well authorization is the last permit required to begin operations and commercial uranium production at Nichols Ranch.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • GFI

    Gold Fields (GFI -2.2%) fires 8,500 workers who refused to halt an illegal stoppage at its KDC...

    Gold Fields (GFI -2.2%) fires 8,500 workers who refused to halt an illegal stoppage at its KDC East mine. Mass dismissals are not unheard of in South Africa and are often part of a hardball negotiating strategy on the part of mine owners.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +1.2%) is rallying ahead of today's Q3 report - short-covering is likely a big...

    Facebook (FB +1.2%) is rallying ahead of today's Q3 report - short-covering is likely a big factor (16.5% of the float was shorted as of Sep. 28). The bull argument: shares are down 48% from the IPO and 27% since the Q2 report; monthly users just topped 1B; and Facebook is pulling out all the stops to improve monetization, with some success. The bear argument: U.S. PC activity is plunging thanks to the mobile shift (this includes gaming activity), shares still carry lofty forward P/Es, and buyers could be cautious ahead of a huge Nov. 14 lockup expiration.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 6 Comments
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca (AZN -1.6%) is partnering with Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -1.6%) to co-develop...

    AstraZeneca (AZN -1.6%) is partnering with Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -1.6%) to co-develop and co-commercialize IRWD's linaclotide in China. Linaclotide is the first and only guanylate cyclase-C agonist approved by the FDA. Under the terms of the agreement, AZN will make an upfront payment of $25M to IRWD and will share in the net profits and losses. IRWD will also be eligible for $125M in additional sales-related milestone payments.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 1 Comment

    Cynosure (CYNO -1%) slips into the red after an early gain of over 10% following its solid Q3 earnings beat this morning. Rival Xerox (XRX -7.7%) is tumbling following its revenue miss.
